Draw Plausible Values from a Fitted Latent Variable Model

drawPVs.Rd

Generates plausible values (PVs) for latent abilities based on a fitted marginal maximum likelihood (MML) or EM-based latent variable model. The PVs are drawn from subject-specific normal distributions using posterior mean and variance estimates.

Usage

drawPVs(mmlcomp, npv = 10L, verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

mmlcomp

An object returned by a latent variable model fitting function (e.g., fit_gvem or a related EM-based estimator), which contains posterior summaries of latent abilities.

npv

Integer. Number of plausible values to draw for each subject. Default is 10.

verbose

Logical. If TRUE, prints progress information during plausible value generation. Default is TRUE.

Value

A data frame containing plausible values, with one row per subject and npv columns corresponding to the generated plausible values.

Details

Plausible values are generated by sampling from the posterior predictive distribution of the latent abilities. For each subject, draws are taken independently from a normal distribution parameterized by the posterior mean and variance obtained from the fitted model. This approach propagates measurement uncertainty in secondary analyses.
